greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of factorizations of n>=2 into factors greater than 1 with no common divisor other than 1 (a(1)=0 by convention).
comment: Let (e1, e2, ..., ek) be a prime-signature of n (that is, n = p^e1 * q^e2 * ... * r^ek for some primes, p, q, ..., r). Then a(n) is the number of ways of partitioning multiset {e1 x 1, e2 x 2, ..., ek x k} into multisets such that none of the numbers 1 .. k is present in all member multisets of that set partition. - _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from exponents in factorization of n
program: (PARI) A281116(n, m=n, facs=List([])) = if(1==n, (1==gcd(Vec(facs))), my(s=0, newfacs); fordiv(n, d, if((d>1)&&(d<=m), newfacs = List(facs); listput(newfacs,d); s += A281116(n/d, d, newfacs))); (s)); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jan 15 2017
ext: Term a(1) = 0 prepended by _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 08 2018
